info.title: Vatstack API
info.description: A suite of VAT APIs which let you validate VAT numbers with government services, look up VAT rates by ISO country code, calculate price quotes with centralized VAT rules and store transactions with each sale for VAT reporting.

error.description: Error response from the Vatstack API.

code.description: For validations, a short string indicating the [error code](https://vatstack.com/docs/validations).

message.description: Human-readable message providing more details about the error.

validation.description: Validate your business customer’s VAT number against official government servers in real-time. The API asynchronously validates VAT numbers for you if government services experience downtime.

active.description: Boolean indicating whether the company exists and is active. Use `valid` to check whether the business is also VAT-registered.

code.description: In the event of an error, this field will contain the error code.

company_address.description: Address of the company the VAT number is associated with. Servers of Germany and Spain won’t return a value for privacy reasons and will default to `null`.

company_name.description: Name of the company the VAT number is associated with. Servers of Germany and Spain won’t return a value for privacy reasons and will default to `null`.

company_type.description: Type of the company entity returned by the respective government service (where available).

consultation_number.description: If you save your own VAT number in your dashboard, the reply will contain a unique consultation number. The consultation number enables you to prove to a tax administration of a Member State that you have checked a VAT number at the `requested` date, and obtained a validation result.

country_code.description: 2-letter ISO country code. Note that while Greek VAT numbers contain the `EL` country code, our response will return the ISO country code `GR`.

created.description: ISO date at which the object was created.

requested.description: ISO date at which the validation request was originally performed. Types `eu_vat` and `gb_vat` do not specify a time.

updated.description: ISO date at which the object was updated.

valid.description: Boolean indicating whether the vat_number is registered for VAT. If government services are down, the value will be `null` and re-checked automatically for you.

valid_format.description: Boolean indicating whether the VAT number contained in `query` is in a valid format.

vat_number.description: VAT number extracted from your query without the country code.

type.description: Restrict validation to a region. If not provided, the type is automatically determined based on the VAT number given.

query.description: VAT number that you want to validate.

202.description: Validation request was accepted and will resume asynchronously.

get.summary: Retrieves all validation objects in order of creation, with the most recent appearing highest.

parameters.name: batch
parameters.description: Show only objects that belong to a batch with the given identifier.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The VAT number you want to search in the `query` field of your records.

parameters.name: requested_since
parameters.description: Show only objects where the `requested` date is this date or later. Format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

parameters.name: requested_until
parameters.description: Show only objects where the `requested` date is this date or earlier. Format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Show only objects of specified type field.

has_more.description: True if this list has another page of items after this one that can be fetched.
